text: Marián Čalfa (born 7 May 1946) is the former Prime Minister of Czechoslovakia during and after the Velvet Revolution. He was de facto acting President for 19 days. Čalfa resigned from the Federal Government after the defeat of the Public Against Violence in the elections of 1992. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Prime ministers of Czechoslovakia
title: Marián Čalfa
